I recommend "Downfall" if you're looking for a war movie with excellent performances from Zan Marolt, Ljubomir Kerekes, Joy Bryant, James Brolin, James Brolin, Scott Anderson, Dylan Baker and director Steven Spielberg. The movie tells the story of a ruthless rancher who kidnaps his infidel wife and goes on a mission to kill all the men who kidnapped his infidel wife.
Another recommendation is "The Hunting Party" if you're looking for a war movie with excellent performances from Zan Marolt, Ljubomir Kerekes, Joy Bryant, James Brolin, James Brolin, Scott Anderson, Dylan Baker and director Steven Spielberg. The movie tells the story in which a group of friends set out on a camping trip in rural Italy. They come across a group of local villagers who are trapped in a cave and have been captured by a ruthless rancher who lives nearby.
The final recommendation is "A Farewell to Arms" if you're looking for a war movie with excellent performances from Zan Marolt, Ljubomir Kerekes, Joy Bryant, James Brolin, James Brolin, Scott Anderson, Dylan Baker and director Steven Spielberg. The movie tells the story of a group of American soldiers who are part of a larger Allied force that is fighting against invading German forces in Europe during World War 2.
In conclusion, all three movies are excellent war movies with outstanding performances from Zan Marolt, Ljubomir Kerekes, Joy Bryant, James Brolin, James Brolin, Scott Anderson, Dylan Baker and director Steven Spielberg.

conversation.text:
Based on your preference cues, I recommend Incendies (2010) as a fitting recommendation for your search.
Incendies is a French drama film directed by Denis Villeneuve and based on the short story collection The Fire That Shakes the Barley  by Khaled Hosseini.
The film tells three stories that are interrelated:
- A young woman searches for her missing brother, who was captured and taken to Afghanistan by the Taliban.
- An older man searches for his lost wife, who disappeared with their children after they were forced to flee their home country because of religious persecution.
- A young boy searches for his lost grandfather, who disappeared during a trip he made to Africa to visit an orphanage he had established in collaboration with the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF).
The film was released in France on September 26, 2010 by Gaumont Film Company and in the United States on February 23, 2011 by Lions Gate Entertainment.
Incendies received widespread critical acclaim and was one of the most successful films at the box office in both France and the United States.
It won three awards from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS): Best Foreign Language Film, Best Director for a Foreign Language Film, and Best Adapted screenplay for a Foreign Language Film.
It also received five prizes from the European Film Critics Association (EFCFA)): Best Foreign Language Film, Best Director for a Foreign Language Film, Best Adapted screenplay for a Foreign Language Film, Best Actress for a Foreign Language Film, and Best Supporting Actress for a Foreign Language Film.
It also received three prizes from the National Society of Film Critics (NSFFC)): Most Promising New Feature Director, and Best Adapted screenplay for a Feature-Length Film

Based on your preferences, I would recommend "American Sniper". It is a biographical drama based on the memoirs of Chris Kyle, a U.S Navy SEAL who served four tours of duty in Iraq and Afghanistan between 2002 and 2011.

The film follows Chris Kyle's journey from his hometown of El Paso, Texas, to the war zones of Iraq and Afghanistan between 2002 and 2011. It also shows how he cope with the trauma and stress of being a SEAL who fought in some of the bloodiest wars in human history.

The film stars Bradley Cooper as Chris Kyle, along with Jason Witzel as the fellow SEAL Kyle's partner.
